result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donkita R Lee

defendant.name: Lee, Donkita R

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donkita R Lee in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Donkita R Lee.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Case is in contest posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. 
Case adjourned to Branch 13. 
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 25, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Donkita R Lee in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Donkita R Lee.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Attorney Krejci was recently appointed, has received discovery. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 31st, 2022

Defendant Donkita R Lee in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defendant does not have an attorney at this time. Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation  Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney John Krejci to represent defendant at County expense at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant to repay the County at a rate of $25.00 PER WEEK. Repayment to begin OCTOBER 31ST, 2022.  Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment 
Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Donkita R Lee
Current: 947 Mineral Springs Drive #5, Port Washington, WI 53074 United States  (Effective: 08-10-2022)
Prior: 947 West Mineral Street #5, Milwaukee, WI 53204

Defendant to also follow any conditions from case 21CV5488.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/12/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CS.

Defendant Donkita R Lee in court. Gregg Herman as well as student intern Josh Rather, under the student practicde rule, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Donkita R Lee not in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/12/22 @ 1:30p
